hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Overreaction Fade in Low-Liquidity Alts
hypothesis_content.statement: For lower-liquidity approved alts (e.g., BAT, CRV, TRUMP), a price move exceeding +/-15% within 2 hours following a news headline (categorized by news sentiment engine) will partially revert within the next 6 hours when the overall market regime is NEUTRAL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-liquidity altcoins are prone to exaggerated, knee-jerk reactions to news as order books are thin. In a neutral broader market, the initial overreaction is often driven by emotional retail trading and is subsequently faded by more sophisticated actors, leading to a partial retracement as liquidity normalizes.
entry_conditions: Asset in lower-liquidity approved list (BAT, CRV, TRUMP, etc.)
News sentiment score is either highly positive or highly negative
Price moves > +15% or < -15% within 2 hours of news timestamp
Fade the move: Short on +15% spike, Long on -15% drop. Entry on the close of the 1H candle where the extreme is first reached.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 2-hour news-driven move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price continues an additional 5% in the direction of the initial move beyond the entry point

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The initial news-driven move continues in its direction past the 5% stop-loss level in the majority (>55%) of cases, indicating the move is sustainable and not an overreaction.
